business.headline: Inheritance war: How fight for PRS Oberoi's legacy is unfolding in courtThe dispute revolves around late PRS Oberoi's estate, with conflicting wills and claims on shares, properties, and assets.

Amazon, Flipkart violated competition laws by favouring certain sellers: ReportThe investigation was triggered by a complaint from the Delhi Vyapar Mahasangh, which is an affiliate of the country's biggest trade body, Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), that represents 80 million retailers.

US Fed poised to cut rates: Can it steer economy toward soft landing?After months of elevated interest rates, the Fed is likely to lower its benchmark rate, potentially giving a much-needed break to the economy.

Sensex, Nifty close slightly higher; Bajaj Housing Finance shines on debutThe S&P BSE Sensex ended the trading session 97.84 points higher at 82,988.78, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 27.25 points to settle at 25,383.75.

Sebi withdraws statement blaming external elements for staff protestsJust under two weeks ago, Sebi had issued a statement suggesting that external forces were behind the unrest among its staff, which was seen as an attempt to discredit the organisation and its leadership.

Missed Bajaj Housing Finance listing day rally? Check these alternate optionsBajaj Housing Finance bumper listing: By the end of the trading session, the company's stock price stood at Rs 164.99, marking a significant increase over its IPO issue price. But for those who missed out on the listing day windfall, what are the next steps?

Oberoi inheritance war: Siblings clash over late PRS Oberoi's willOn one side are Vikramjit Oberoi, Natasha Oberoi, and Arjun Oberoi. On the other side is Anastasia Oberoi, PRS Oberoi's daughter from his second marriage to Mirjana Jojic Oberoi.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit upper circuit after bumper listing: What's next?Bajaj Housing Finance listing: By midday, the shares hit an upper circuit at Rs 164.99, representing an overall premium of 135.70% over the IPO price.

'Can afford, but won't buy': Edelweiss MF CEO on not owning luxury carsEdelweiss MF Radhika Gupta CEO currently owns an Innova, which is known for its practicality and reliability rather than for being a luxury car.

From branch manager to CEO: How Atul Jain transformed Bajaj Housing FinanceAtul Jain, now 52, has been with the Bajaj Group for over two decades. He began his career in investment banking, working as a project executive at PNB Capital Services Limited and later at Prudential Capital Markets Limited.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares list at 114% premium. What should investors do? With Bajaj Housing Finance shares debuting at a staggering 114% premium, investors face a pivotal choice: lock in profits now or stay the course for potential long-term rewards. Find out what experts suggest for your next move.
Kross shares list flat on D-Street: Should you book profit or hold? Kross listing: Shares of Kross made a flat debut opening at Rs 240 on NSE and BSE, the same as its IPO price.

Bajaj Housing Finance turns multibagger on listing: Book profits or hold?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With this blockbuster entry on Dalal Street, the key dilemma for investors is now whether to book profits immediately or hold onto their positions for long-term gains.
Sensex, Nifty rally as Fed rate cut looms; markets stay bullishThe S&P BSE Sensex added 169.53 points to 83,060.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 62.55 points to 25,419.05

Bajaj Housing Finance makes bumper debut as shares list at 114% premiumBajaj Housing Finance listing: The shares were allocated to successful bidders on September 13, and the listing gains of Rs 80 per share slightly exceeded the grey market premium (GMP).

Gold, silver price today, September 16, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 16, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Amazon, Flipkart and major smartphone brands face antitrust heat: ReportThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) has found that these companies have been involved in exclusive product launches on their platforms, which may have restricted competition and harmed smaller businesses.

Rent vs buy: What's the smarter financial move for you?Renting offers the freedom to move, explore career opportunities, and invest in other ventures. Buying a home, on the other hand, offers long-term security, a sense of ownership, and equity building.

Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal to resign, key AAP meet to pick Delhi Chief Minister today Live UpdatesA crucial meeting of AAP MLAs will be held at 11.30 am at Arvind Kejriwal's residence to pick the next Delhi Chief Minister.

100 days of Modi 3.0: BJP, ministries gear up to share success storiesSeveral Union Ministers will hold press conferences to give a report card on the first 100 days of the third term of the NDA government, which coincides with PM Modi's 74th birthday.

Mamata Banerjee agrees to doctors' demands, announces removal of Kolkata top copMamata Banerjee announced the removal of Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal and the Deputy Commissioner (North), who faced bribery allegations from the family of the trainee doctor who was raped and killed in Kolkata.

PM turns 74, BJP leaders extend birthday wishes, call him 'captain of the country'Narendra Damodardas Modi, born on September 17, 1950, in the modest town of Mehsana, Gujarat, has risen from humble beginnings to become one of India's most influential political leaders.

You grow older rapidly at ages 44 and 60. Can you prepare for it?If you thought you would age gradually, you might be wrong. A new study has revealed that humans experience two periods of rapid ageing, once in mid-40s and again in early 60s.
Inheritance war: How fight for PRS Oberoi's legacy is unfolding in courtThe dispute revolves around late PRS Oberoi's estate, with conflicting wills and claims on shares, properties, and assets.

AAP to announce next Delhi Chief Minister's name at noon after MLAs' meetArvind Kejriwal News Live Updates: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is expected to resign later on Tuesday, with AAP MLAs scheduled to hold a key meeting at his residence at 11:30 am to choose his successor. Kejriwal is likely to meet Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena at 4:30 pm to formally submit his resignation.

Video: Bodycam footage shows dramatic arrest of Trump assassination bid suspectThe footage shows the gunman, Ryan Routh, walking backwards with his hands over his head before being handcuffed by US police officers.

From Bella Ciao to Ar Kobe: How songs, art keep Kolkata doctor's protest aliveKolkata's RG Kar protest movement blends artistic expression with activism, using songs like 'Bella Ciao' and 'Karar Oi Louha Kapat', along with cultural performances to amplify the demand for justice and unite the city's diverse voices.

Kolkata rape-murder: Supreme Court to take up missing autopsy document issueKolkata rape-murder: The Bengal government will have to inform the court about the security facilities it has provided for the doctors and about the missing challan that is issued with the post-mortem report.

Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs arrested amid sex trafficking allegations American rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs has been arrested. This comes in the wake of numerous allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking against the musician.

Engineer Rashid explains why he joined hands with Jamaat for J&K pollsSpeaking exclusively with India Today TV, Engineer Rashid said that Jamaat-e-Islami participating in the electoral process should be welcomed.

Kartik Aaryan, other celebs attend Eknath Shinde's Ganapati celebrationsGanapati celebrations at Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's residence continued. On the night of September 16, celebs like Kartik Aaryan, Swapnil Joshi and Isha Koppikar were seen in attendance.

Trump, JD Vance blame Kamala Harris's 'rhetoric' for assassination bidFollowing the second assassination attempt on his life, Trump highlighted that the suspect, 58-years-old Ryan Wesley Routh, echoed Biden and Harris's language, suggesting that he is a threat to American democracy if he wins the upcoming November elections and retakes the White House.

Will ballot defeat bullet in Jammu and Kashmir? Top focus on Gaurav Sawant's showOn India First, host Gaurav Sawant discusses a 24-hour long encounter in Baramulla, North Kashmir, captured on drone cameras. The show also covers Amit Shah's pledge to bury terror, the shift from bullets to ballots, and the political battles in Delhi and Jammu and Kashmir. The programme also highlights the upcoming first phase of elections in Jammu and Kashmir, the Congress party's manifesto, and the anti-terror operations in Poonch and Kishtwar.

India raises vandalism of New York's Swaminarayan Temple with US: UnacceptableThe Indian Mission in the US condemned the vandalism of the BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in New York, urging law enforcement to take swift action against the perpetrators.

Priyanka Chopra's birthday wish for Nick Jonas is all about family momentsPriyanka Chopra wished her best husband, Nick Jonas, on his birthday with cute pictures of his family. She shared photos of them with their daughter, Malti.

Meta bans Russian state media outlets over 'foreign interference activity'The ban comes after the US filed money-laundering charges earlier this month against two employees of the Russian media outlet 'RT', for what officials said was a scheme to hire an American company to produce online content to influence the 2024 election.

India vs China, Asian Champions Trophy final: Favourites India eye 5th crownIndia and China will face off in the Asian Champions Trophy Final 2024. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led team are heavy favourites to lift the title on Tuesday, 17 September. Here's everything you need to know about the clash.

India condemns Khamenei's 'suffering of Muslims' remark: Look at your recordIndia condemned remarks by Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei on the "suffering of Muslims," calling them "misinformed" and urging nations to assess their own record.

Video: BJP MLA falls on tracks during Vande Bharat flag-off amid huge rushEtawah BJP MLA Sarita Bhadoria fell on railway tracks amid a rush while flagging off a Vande Bharat Express at the Etawah Railway Station on Monday.

Trump assassination bid suspect waited near golf club for 12 hours, probe findsSunday's incident raised fresh questions about how an armed suspect was able to get so close to Trump, just two months after another gunman fired at him in Pennsylvania.

Old CCTV clip of cop removing uniform after argument with BJP leader sparks rowSingrauli Superintendent of Police Nivedita Gupta said that the video was over eight months old and strict action was taken against the personnel, Vinod Mishra, for disrespecting the uniform.

Endured Opposition's insult, worked on government agenda: PM on NDA 3.0's 100 daysPrime Minister Narendra Modi slammed the opposition parties, accusing them of making fun of him in the first 100 days of NDA 3.0 and said he instead focused on completing the government's agenda during the period.

Watch: Sunny Deol's vacation with father Dharmendra, enjoys 'jalebi' in snowSunny Deol is currently enjoying his trip with his parents, Dharmendra and Satwant Kaur. The actor gave a glimpse of his vacation on social media.

Watch: Salman Khan to return with Bigg Boss 18, first teaser outThe teaser for Bigg Boss 18 has been released, confirming Salman Khan's return as host. It also introduces this year's theme, 'Time Ka Taandav'.

GOAT box office Day 12: Vijay's film enters Rs 400-crore club globallyThalapathy Vijay and director Venkat Prabhu's GOAT aka The Greatest of All Time is said to have surpassed Rs 400 crore globally. The film is continuing its steady run in theatres.

Liverpool manager Arne Slot 'not scared' of AC Milan ahead of openerChampions League: Liverpool coach Arne Slot said his team has great respect for AC Milan, but the Premier League club will not be intimidated when the two European giants meet in their opener.

Tunisia's Ons Jabeur to miss remainder of 2024 season due to injuryThree-time Grand Slam finalist Ons Jabeur has announced her withdrawal from the 2024 tennis season, citing a persistent shoulder injury. The decision was made in consultation with her medical team after a challenging year plagued by multiple injuries.

Shadman Islam preparing for 'challenging' India by working on technical flawBangladesh opener Shadman Islam is working on his technical flaw ahead of the India Test series acknowledging the challenges that lay ahead of him.

Glasgow set to be announced as host city for 2026 Common Wealth Games: ReportThe Scottish capital of Glasgow is set to be announced as the host city of a "scaled down" Commonwealth Games in 2026, a year after Australian state Victoria pulled out due to ballooning costs, reported PTI on Monday, September 16.

Sakshee Malikkh, Geeta Phogat announce Wrestling Champions Super LeagueWrestlers Sakshee Malikkh and Geeta Phogat have announced that they are planning to launch Wrestling Champions Super League to help budding wrestlers in India. Phogat said that she and Sakshee had been planning for this for a long time.

Team India start intense training before Chepauk TestIND vs BAN: Rohit Sharma's India have started training hard before their opening Test against Bangladesh gets underway on Thursday, September 19 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

Kohli's passion is unmatched: Sarfaraz recalls RCB days before Bangladesh TestsSarfaraz Khan recalled his RCB days with Virat Kohli and said that the star batter's spirit and  passion is unmatched. Sarfaraz and Kohli reunite and this time for the Indian Test team.

Olympic champions, a multi-millionaire among 7 candidates for IOC presidencyThe head of World Athletics, Sebastian Coe, Prince Feisal al Hussein of Jordan, and  Kirsty Coventry, a two-time Olympic gold medallist in swimming from Zimbabwe, are amongst the seven candidates who will be in the race for the International Olympic Committee president role. Thomas Bach will vacate the prestigious position in 2025.

Sinner hires Djokovic's ex-coaches after clean chit in doping saga Jannik Sinner roped in Marco Panichi and Ulises Badio after parting ways with Giacomo Naldi and Umberto Ferrara. The World No.1 recently won the US Open after beating Taylor Fritz in the final.

IND vs BAN: Rohit set to surpass Sehwag for most sixes by an Indian in TestsRohit Sharma nears many crucial milestones as the Indian team is set to take on Bangladesh in a two-match Test series. The MA Chidambaram Stadium will host the Test opener on September 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
